objects.description:
As a user, I want to long tap on a number in call log, and Action menu shown.

Prerequisite: A DUAL SIM device, only 1 SIM in either slot 1 or 2, with some call entries in call log (missed, incoming & outgoing) but numbers are not stored in Contacts.

Feature changed since v2.1, behavior is different in v2.0.
objects.name: [Call log] Action menu shown by long tapping on a number in call log, a Dual SIM device with one SIM in it

steps.instruction: Open "Call log" in "Dialer".
Go to tab "All".

steps.expected:
"Action menu" shown without the "Call" option.
2 available options are "Send Message" & "Call Information".
steps.instruction: Long tap on a missed call from a contact.

steps.expected:
"Action menu" shown without the "Call" option.
2 available options are "Send Message" & "Call Information".
steps.instruction: Repeat step 3 for long tapping on an incoming call and an outgoing call.
Go to tab "Missed".

steps.expected:
"Action menu" shown without the "Call" option.
2 available options are "Send Message" & "Call Information".
steps.instruction: Repeat step 3 for a missed call.
Repeat step 3~4 for a non contact number.

tags.description: Test cases for Dual SIM Dual Standby function. Only test on DSDS supported devices.
tags.name: DSDS

objects.description:
As a user, I want to tap on a number in call log, and the call is made through network.

Prerequisite: A DUAL SIM device, only 1 SIM in either slot 1 or 2, with some call entries in call log (missed, incoming, outgoing) and numbers are stored in Contacts.
objects.name: [Call log] Call made simplely by tapping on a number in call log, numbers STORED in Contacts, a Dual SIM device with one SIM in it

steps.instruction: Open "Call log" in "Dialer".
Go to tab "All".

steps.expected:
Call made through, and picked up from that party.
Call page shown with name, number (or picture if any).
steps.instruction: Tap on a missed call.

steps.expected:
Call made through, and picked up from that party.
Call page shown with name, number (or picture if any).
steps.instruction: Repeat step 3 for tapping on an incoming call and an outgoing call.
Go to tab "Missed".

steps.expected:
Call made through, and picked up from that party.
Call page shown with name, number (or picture if any).
steps.instruction: Repeat step 3 for a missed call.

objects.description:
Check new account can be created in Settings app once FTE is completed 


Note: Use http://10minutemail.com/10MinuteMail/index.html to create temporary email address for testing purpose
objects.name: Smoketest: Successful Sign up in Settings

steps.expected:
Verify the account is created successfully, pending verification with 'Done' button active
Verify the screen layout is correct
Verify the user needs to enter password with at least 8 characters long

Verify the user should be at least 13 years old, according to COPPA definition: http://www.coppa.org/coppa.htm

If the user selects birth year that corresponds to the age of under 13, the device should show rejection screen.
steps.instruction: Enter Settings -> Firefox accounts, click 'Create account or sign in'.  Enter email address, year of birth, and password to create a new account

steps.expected: The phone displays the message showing the account is now verified, within 5 minutes of verification
steps.instruction: Verify the account by pressing 'Verify' button in the email sent to the account holder's email address

steps.expected: FxAccount sign in page is shown with "Create account or sign in" button
steps.instruction: Go to Settings->Firefox accounts, and press sign out

steps.expected: Verify the user is logged in successfully
steps.instruction: Enter the credential of already created Firefox account from Step 1

objects.name: [Vertical Homescreen] Remembering vertical position while using applications

steps.instruction: Go to the vertical homescreen.
Flick up to see the last icons.
Start an application.

steps.expected: Verify that the vertical position is the same as before launching the application.
steps.instruction: Quit the application.
Start an application.

steps.expected: Verify that the vertical position is the same as before launching the application.
steps.instruction: Tap Home Button.
Start an application.
Long press Home Button.

steps.expected: Verify that, after closing the last one, the vertical position is the same as before launching the application.
steps.instruction: Close all running applications.

objects.name: [Vertical Homescreen] Remembering vertical position and landscape locked applications

steps.instruction: Go to the vertical homescreen.
Flick up to see the last icons.
Open the web browser to to http://mozqa.com/qa-testcase-data/webapi/apps/
Install landscapeorientationlock application.
Quit the web browser
Start landscapeorientationlock.

steps.expected: Verify that, after closing the application, the vertical position is the same as before launching the application.
steps.instruction: Tap Home Button.

steps.expected:
look at the icon; should be two dots with a number in a box.
(see 2014-0514-15-47-13.png )
steps.instruction: navigate to the Calendar app

steps.expected: verify that Calendar app launches; header should be orange w/ white text.  + should not have a drop shadow.
steps.instruction: launch Calendar

steps.expected:
Calendar settings page should be white with grey text/black text, except done which is blue.
( see 2014-05-14-15-59-30.png )

header should be orange with white text, checkbox should be a light blue empty box, if select, it should turn blue with a white check

objects.name: 2.0 Visual Refresh : Camera

steps.expected: Camera app should launch.  the preview should be full screen with buttons floating.  Bottom center button depends on the settings for camera/video; red for video, camera icon for camera.
steps.instruction: Launch camera app

steps.expected: If the device has a front/back camera, there should be a camera switch icon in the upper left hand corner.
steps.instruction: check to see if the device has a front/back camera

steps.expected: If the device has a flash associated with a camera, a flash icon should appear in the upper middle.  Tapping it 3 times should cycle the flash on, flash off, flash auto.
steps.instruction: Make sure you are in camera mode.  check to see if the device has a flash; if the device has a flash switch to the camera that the flash is associated with; tap it 3 times.

steps.expected: it should cycle flash on/flash off.  flash on will keep the flash on.
steps.instruction: Switch to video mode, check to see if the device has a flash; if the device has a flash switch to the camera that the flash is associated with; tap it 2 times.

steps.expected: if the camera is HDR capable, there should be a HDR mode, Self-Timer and Grid lines.
steps.instruction: switch back to camera mode; Hit the options button ( the three lines in the upper right hand corner)

steps.expected: Immediate change should be that the gridlines show splitting the screen into thirds.
steps.instruction: Select Grid Lines, select on.

steps.expected: an icon to the middle left of the screen should appear indicating there is a timer.
steps.instruction: go back to the options, select self timer, 2 seconds

steps.expected:
when the picture is taken, there are large numbers indicating a countdown to the picture being taken and the picture is taken.
There should be a preview of the picture that was taken in the bottom left corner.
steps.instruction: Take a picture.

steps.expected: There should be a HDR icon to the middle left
steps.instruction: go back to the options, turn timer off; turn HDR on if it is a camera that is HDR capable.  Skip this step if the camera is not HDR capable.

steps.expected: the button at the bottom middle button should change to a red dot in the middle of a white and red circle.
steps.instruction: select video

objects.description:
Implementation bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=933902


User Stories:
1. As a user, while taking a picture using the camera app I want the ability to pinch zoom in and zoom out so I can make the subject appear bigger or smaller
2. As a user, while pinching to zoom in or zoom out I want to see a slide bar where sliding up increases the zoom level

Acceptance Criteria:
1. When the user starts using the camera, he/she can pinch the screen to zoom in and zoom out
2. When the user pinches to zoom in or zoom out a slider should appear on the right
3. The user can use the slider to zoom in or zoom out. Sliding up should increase the zoom level
4. While performing the zoom function the object should appear larger or smaller based on the function performed
5. The user can capture a picture at certain zoom level and be able to see the same image in the gallery
objects.name: [Camera] Verify digital zoom functionality using pinch gesture

steps.expected: The camera app successfully launches.
steps.instruction: Open the camera app.

steps.expected: You can see the object through the viewfinder.
steps.instruction: Point the camera to an object that you want to photograph.

steps.expected: The camera will zoom in as you continue to the pinch motion.
steps.instruction: Using a pinch gesture, zoom in on the object you wish to photograph.

steps.expected: The picture should be shown correctly in the gallery.
steps.instruction: While zoomed in, take a picture using the shutter button.

Acceptance Criteria:
 1. When the user starts using the camera, he/she can pinch the screen to zoom in and zoom out 2. When the user pinches to zoom in or zoom out a slider should appear on the right 3. The user can use the slider to zoom in or zoom out. Sliding up should increase the zoom level 4. objects.description:
User Stories:
1. As a user, I can set the self-timer mode in my camera settings to off, 2 sec, 10 sec
2. As a user, when I set the self timer to a value that value should persist until I change it again

Implementation bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=966837
objects.name: [Camera] Verify functionality of Self Timer

steps.expected: The camera app successfully launches.
steps.instruction: Open the camera app.

steps.expected: The Options menu opens with several choices. Depending on the camera hardware, the options may be: HDR, Self-Timer and Grid Lines.
steps.instruction: Select the Options button.

steps.expected: A visual indication appears briefly in the user interface above the shutter button to confirm the setting.
steps.instruction: Tap the self timer button and select 2 seconds.

steps.expected: A counter appears in the user interface which counts down the seconds until the shutter is fired. After two seconds, the shutter fires and the picture should be available in thumbnail view.
steps.instruction: Press the shutter button

steps.expected: A counter appears in the user interface which counts down the seconds until the shutter is fired. After five seconds, the shutter fires and the picture should be available in thumbnail view.
steps.instruction: Repeat Step 3, this time selecting 5 seconds.

steps.expected: A counter appears in the user interface which counts down the seconds until the shutter is fired. After ten seconds, the shutter fires and the picture should be available in thumbnail view.
steps.instruction: Repeat Step 3, this time selecting 10 seconds

objects.description:
User Stories:
1. As a user, I can set the self-timer mode in my camera settings to off, 2 sec, 10 sec
2. As a user, when I set the self timer to a value that value should persist until I change it again

Implementation bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=966837
objects.name: [Camera] Verify tapping self timer while counting down stops the timer countdown

steps.expected: The camera app successfully launches.
steps.instruction: Open the camera app.

steps.expected: The Options menu opens with several choices. Depending on the camera hardware, the options may be: HDR, Self-Timer and Grid Lines.
steps.instruction: Select the Options button.

steps.expected: A visual indication appears briefly in the user interface above the shutter button to confirm the setting.
steps.instruction: Tap the self timer button and select 5 seconds.

steps.expected: The timer should stop, and the shutter should not fire - no picture should be taken.
steps.instruction: Tap on the screen while the timer is counting down.

objects.description:
Homescreen functions properly after recovering from a serious error. 
Please see issue: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=975368
Note: You will need to have an Engineering build flashed on your phone as User builds do not have the root access needed to perform this test.
objects.name: Homescreen functions properly after recovering from a serious error

steps.expected:
The Process ID (PID) of the Homescreen process is displayed. For example,

$ adb shell b2g-info | grep Homescreen

Homescreen 1909  390    5.3    1 15.6 17.6 28.0  2.5  78.9       2 u0_a1909

In this case, the PID is 1909.
steps.instruction: Connect your phone to a computer that has "adb" installed. Open a terminal and execute the command "adb shell b2g-info | grep Homescreen".

steps.expected: The Home screen is displayed.
steps.instruction: Open several apps such as Dialer, Browser, Messaging, Settings, Marketplace, etc .  Press the home button to return to the homescreen.

steps.expected: The Home screen loses its app icons and only the wallpaper is displayed. Then a message appears at the bottom "Homescreen just crashed." Then the app icons re-appear.
steps.instruction:
In the terminal, execute the command "adb shell kill -11 (homescreen PID)". For example, 

$ adb shell kill -11 1909

steps.expected: The Home screen functions as intended. All the opened apps are still open and function as expected.
steps.instruction: Navigate through the Home screen and open apps.

objects.description:
Older WAP Push notifications are replaced with the latest WAP Push notification when they have the same URL.

Prerequisite: Use NowSMS application on a computer to send WAP Push messages
objects.name: Older WAP Push notifications are replaced with the latest WAP Push notification when they have the same URL

steps.instruction: Enable WAP Push in Settings > Call setting.

In NowSMS, select WAP Push Message, send a message with following settings: 

            Push Type: SI 
            WAP URL: a linkable URL ex: www.google.com
            Text: L1
            Signal Action: Low
            SI ID: ex: 1234
            SI Created: Set current date and time, ex: 2013-08-04T03:33:33Z
Pull down notification tray on the device to see that the message has been received. (Do not tap on it)
Send another WAP Push Message with identical settings, except with Signal Action: Medium and updated current date and time.
Pull down notification tray on the device and confirm that the first message is not ""Expired"", but instead replaced with the second message.
Send another WAP Push Message with identical settings, except with Signal Action High and updated current date and time.

steps.expected: Older WAP Push notifications are replaced with the latest WAP Push notification when they have the same URL.
steps.instruction: Pull down notification tray on the device and confirm that the second message is not ""Expired"", but instead replaced with the third message".

objects.description:
The user can unlock the phone after locking the phone while playing a game downloaded from the Marketplace. 

Prerequisite: Lockscreen is enabled in settings. 

Please see this issue: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1015073
objects.name: The user can unlock the phone without issue after locking the phone while playing a game

steps.instruction: Open the Marketplace application.
Search for the game "Skate Jumper".
Download the game and install it on the DUT.
Open the "Skate Jumper" game and play it.
While playing the game, press the "Power" button to lock the DUT.

steps.expected: The phone can be unlocked without issue.
steps.instruction: Press the "Power" button gain and unlock the phone.

steps.expected: The phone can be unlocked without issue when the user locks their phone while playing a game.
steps.instruction: Repeat all these steps with at least 3 different games downloaded from the Marketplace.

objects.description:
Please make sure that your Firefox Accounts and Persona have the same credentials for this test.
I.E. my email should be xxx@mozilla.com and password should be 1111111 for both the FxA and Persona log-ins.
objects.name: Enable/Disable FMD via Settings on FxOS Phone

steps.expected: Under Account Management, you should see 'Find My Device'. If Find My Device is disabled, the world 'disabled' will appear under 'Find My Device'. If Find My Device is enabled, the word 'enabled' will appear under 'Find My Device'.
steps.instruction: Open the Settings Application.

steps.expected: After signing in, you should be taken to a screen with a toggle bar saying 'Enable Find My Device'.
steps.instruction: Click on Find My Device.  If this is your first time using the application, Find My Device will be automatically disabled. You will need to click on Find My Device and sign in through the application. If this is not your first time, please skip this step- simply clicking on 'Find My Device' should take you to the toggle bar saying 'Enable Find My Device'.

steps.expected: If you disabled FMD, the toggle bar should now be gray with no check mark. If you enabled FMD the toggle bar should now be blue with a check mark.
steps.instruction: If the application is currently enabled, the toggle bar should be colored blue, and a check mark should be shown on the right side. If it is disabled, the toggle bar should be gray and there should be no check-mark. Press the opposite of what you currently have: if you are enabled, disable, and vice versa.

steps.expected: Under Account Management, you should see 'Find My Device'. If you disabled Find My Device, the world 'disabled' will appear under 'Find My Device'. If Find My Device is enabled, the word 'enabled' will appear under 'Find My Device'.
steps.instruction: Press the back arrow on the top of the screen.

steps.expected:
You should be taken to a web page for your phone. If you are enabled, you should be able to see a location pin on the map for your phone. You should also be able to successfully put your phone into Lost Mode (click on Lost Mode and follow the prompts), Play Sound, and remotely erase your phone. 

If you have disabled FMD, the above features should not be accessible.
steps.instruction: On a web browser, navigate to the Find My Device. For our preliminary testing purposes, this would be located at http://fmd.dev.mozaws.net/. Sign in with your Persona account (see description for a note about Persona account).

objects.description: This is a test to ensure that all of the actions on the FMD website will work properly, regardless of order.
objects.name: Test Sequence of Actions For Find My Device

steps.expected: If all settings are as expected, you should see a dropped pin on the map with the location of your phone. You should see an option to 'Play Sound', 'Lost Mode', or 'Erase' on the website.
steps.instruction: Prerequisites of the test: Make sure that Find My Device is enabled in phone settings, make sure that Geolocation is enabled. Navigate to Find My Device website and log in with your corresponding account.

steps.expected: You should hear your phone play a sound.
steps.instruction: Press the Play Sound button on the website. Make sure that your phone volume is up.

steps.expected: Your phone should lock, and display the message that you entered on the website. Enter your given passcode, the phone should unlock and the message should no longer be shown on the phone.
steps.instruction: Now, press the Lost Mode button on the website. Enter your message, and a passcode.

steps.expected: The sound should play on the phone once again.
steps.instruction: Press the Play Sound button on the website.

steps.expected: The sound should play on the phone once again.
steps.instruction: We will make sure that the Play Sound function will work in sequence, so press the Play Sound button once again.

steps.expected: The sound should play again. Note any delays that happen, if they do.
steps.instruction: Why not try it a third time? Third time's the charm, right? Currently, there exists a bug where the Play Sound is inconsistent and there will be a delay between the button press and the sound play. If this happens, note this!

steps.expected: The phone should lock, and display the new message. You should be able to unlock the phone using the new passcode.
steps.instruction: Now, try enter Lost Mode through the website again. Enter a different message and passcode than you did last.

steps.expected: Your phone should begin the process of erasing itself.
steps.instruction: Now, click on the Erase button on the website.

objects.description: As a user, one expects to be able to log onto the Find My Device website and play ring tones to assist in the search of ones' phone.
objects.name: Play Sound on Device from Find My Device Website

steps.expected: Find My Device should be enabled on your phone.
steps.instruction: Make sure that Find My Device is enabled in phone settings. objects.description: A user should visually be able to distinguish the scrolling through all-day events and hourly events.
objects.name: [Calendar] Visual Way To Distinguish Hourly vs. All-Day Events in Scroll on Day View

steps.expected: Calendar should open, and if you have already added accounts and events, you should be able to see the.
steps.instruction: Open the Calendar app on your phone.

steps.expected: You should see and be able to scroll through your daily events.
steps.instruction: Choose a day that has no events. Create six hourly events, spanning from 12 a.m. to 6 a.m.

steps.expected: The event should appear in its own shelf, to the right of the logo encircling the number 24. The event should appear directly on top of your event starting at 12 a.m. Please see this visual specification for reference: https://bug951075.bugzilla.mozilla.org/attachment.cgi?id=8372122
steps.instruction: On the same day, add an all-day event.

steps.expected: You should now have 2 events in the 'all-day event section' described in the step above.
steps.instruction: On the same day, add another all-day event.

steps.expected: Your all-day events should not scroll along with the hourly events.
steps.instruction: Scroll through the hourly events.

steps.expected: Your hourly events should not scroll along with the all-day events.
steps.instruction: Scroll through the all-day events.

steps.expected: If it does, check your build. If you have the latest build and you're still seeing the same interface as opposed to this: https://bug951075.bugzilla.mozilla.org/attachment.cgi?id=8372122, then there's a problem.
steps.instruction: Lastly, to just to be safe, what you just have tested should look nothing like this if you're running 2.0: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bR077_MtcjA&feature=youtu.be

objects.description: We should be able to successfully play a sound on the device from the FMD website even when one has silenced incoming calls.
objects.name: Play Sound on Device from Website When Device is Set to Silence Incoming Calls

steps.expected: Find My Device should be enabled on your phone.
steps.instruction: Make sure that Find My Device is enabled in phone settings. In the settings menu, under Account Management, Find My Device will have the small text 'Enabled' written under it if it is enabled, and disabled written if it is disabled. If it is disabled, please click on Find My Device and switch the toggle so that FMD is enabled.

steps.expected: Your phone should not play any sounds upon receiving incoming calls.
steps.instruction: Hold down the lock button until you are presented with various options. Select 'Silence incoming calls'.

steps.expected: You should arrive at a website that has a button for 'Play Sound', 'Lost Mode', and 'Erase'.
steps.instruction: Navigate to the Find My Device website, and sign in with your Firefox credentials.

steps.expected: You should hear the sound playing on your phone, despite silencing calls.
steps.instruction: Press the Play Sound button on the website.

objects.description: As a user I would like to lock my device remotely from the Find My Device website, overriding existing settings including a disabled lock screen.
objects.name: Remotely Lock Phone From FMD Website When Lockscreen is Disabled on Phone

steps.expected: Find My Device should be enabled on your phone.
steps.instruction: Make sure that Find My Device is enabled in phone settings. In the settings menu, under Account Management, Find My Device will have the small text 'Enabled' written under it if it is enabled, and disabled written if it is disabled. If it is disabled, please click on Find My Device and switch the toggle so that FMD is enabled.

steps.expected: Your phone should go straight to the home screen after toggling the lock button. You should not see any lock screen.
steps.instruction: Go to your Settings, and find the Privacy & Security section. Go to the section that says Screen Lock, and disable the lock screen.

steps.expected: You should arrive at a website that has a button for 'Play Sound', 'Lost Mode', and 'Erase'.
steps.instruction: Navigate to the Find My Device website, and sign in with your Firefox credentials.

steps.expected: You will be prompted to enter an optional note.
steps.instruction: Now, press the Lost Mode button on the website.

steps.expected: You will arrive at a screen that prompts you to enter a passcode, and confirm it.
steps.instruction: Skip entering the note by pressing the 'Next' button.

steps.expected: Your phone should lock, with no message displayed. You should be able to see a lock screen.
steps.instruction: Enter passcode '0000', and confirm passcode '0000'. Press the 'Activate Lost Mode' button at the bottom.

steps.expected: Your phone should unlock and take you to your homescreen.
steps.instruction: Unlock your phone using the passcode '0000'.

steps.expected: Lock screen should be enabled fully.
steps.instruction: Toggle the lock button once again.

objects.description:
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=960337

As a user, I want to be able to share my ringtones with my friends via NFC, bluetooth, MMS or email

Acceptance Criteria:

1. The user navigates to the sound menu of settings. When the user taps on the change option of the ringer in the sound menu he/she should see a list of ringtones 
2. Longtapping on a ringtone from the list will take you to screen with delete ringtone or share ringtone  options
3. Select 'share ringtone' option
4. A screen with various sharing options should show up: Email, Bluetooth, MMS, NFC
5. Select one of the sharing options and see if sharing a ringtone was successful

objects.description:
PREREQUISITES:
-----
* Cost control app sends an SMS every check balance or top-up request to a predefined number 
Then cost control app waits for an answer for some time via SMS also from a predefined number 
Check balance of cost control app can be requested both on demand and automatically 
Top-up of cost control app can be requested only on demand 
Cost control app contains different predefined SMS numbers per each country based on MCC/MNC 
In some countries a user can check balance or top-up via SMS using the same number as cost control app
objects.name: Verify all SMS received as an answer of an SMS sent by a user will not be silent

steps.expected: All SMS received will not be silent
steps.instruction: SMS is received

objects.description:
Note: This is a hardware dependent feature, and not all devices will support the same number of faces.

1) The maximum number of faces detected depends on hardware. Nexus 4 is 2 and Flame is 5. The number and what faces are detected on the scene is given by hardware. It's a black box for us.

https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=966828

As a user, while in camera mode I want auto focus be set to face tracking if the device is capable of doing face tracking

Acceptance criteria:
1. When the user is in camera mode, the camera attempts face tracking if faces are detected
2. For each face detected there should be a visual indicator
3. Once a face is detected and focused, a single visual focus indicator is shown on the primary face and all other focus indicators should be removed
4. The color of the visual indicator should change indicating that face tracking has been successful
objects.name: [Camera] Verify functionality of Facial Tracking

steps.expected: The camera app successfully launches.
steps.instruction: Open the camera app.

steps.expected: When the face is detected, a white ring will be shown around the face. The maximum number of faces detected depends upon the hardware. See the Description above for specifics.
steps.instruction: Point the camera at a group of faces. You can also open a picture that has a group of faces.

objects.description:
Make sure that your default media memory is set to Internal Storage.  Add some pictures or take some screenshots on your internal memory.

Remove your SD card completely.

Make sure that you have a Firefox Account.
objects.name: Remote Wipe:  Internal Memory Only

steps.expected: FMD should be enabled, and FxA should be signed in.
steps.instruction: In Settings: Sign into FMD with a Firefox Account. Make sure that FMD is enabled.

steps.expected: You should be able to connect to your device.
steps.instruction: On a Web Browser: Navigate to https://find.firefox.com and sign in with your FxA account.

steps.expected: Your device should restart and boot into FTU. Finish going through FTU and verify that the internal storage is actually empty.
steps.instruction: Click on the 'Erase' button, and then click on the Erase confirmation.

objects.description:
Make sure that your default media memory is set to Internal Storage. Add some pictures or take some screenshots on your internal memory.

Plug your SD card to the computer and add some pictures and music to your SD card.

Make sure that you have a Firefox Account.

steps.expected: FMD should be enabled, and FxA should be signed in.

steps.instruction: Click on the 'Erase' button, and then click on the Erase confirmation.

objects.description: An important use case to remember is one in which the person only realizes they've lost their device after some time. The device will likely be asleep in that case. Here, we are testing to ensure that FMD remains usable even after the device is sleeping.
objects.name: Device Should Be Able to Connect to FMD Website after Sleeping

steps.expected: Device should have FMD enabled, FxA account logged in, and should not be connected to USB.
steps.instruction: Sign into FxA, enable FMD, remove device from USB.

steps.expected: Your phone should be located, you should be able to Play Sound, etc.
steps.instruction: Log in to https://find.firefox.com, you should be able to locate your device.

steps.expected: Phone should be asleep. Screen should be black.
steps.instruction: Allow phone to sit idle (80% battery) for 2 hours.

steps.expected: You should be able to connect to and locate your device.
steps.instruction: Go to https://find.firefox.com

objects.name: Commands Should Not Queue Up When FMD is Disabled

steps.expected: FxA should be signed in and FMD should be enabled.
steps.instruction: Sign into FxA on device, and enable FMD.

steps.expected: You should be able to play sound, lock device, etc.
steps.instruction: On a browser: access https://find.firefox.com and sign in with your account.

steps.expected: FMD should be disabled on your device.
steps.instruction: On your device, disable FMD.

steps.expected: Your device should not play sound, lock, etc.
steps.instruction: On the website, attempt to Play Sound, lock device, etc.

steps.expected: Your device should not play sound, lock, or do any of the commands that you sent when FMD was disabled.
steps.instruction: On your device, enable FMD.

objects.description: When a device is offline, you should not be able to toggle between enabling and disabling Find My Device.
objects.name: FMD Should Not Be Able to be Enabled/Disabled When Device is Offline

steps.expected: FxA should be signed in, FMD should be enabled on device.
steps.instruction: Sign into FxA, enable FMD on device.

steps.expected: FMD should be enabled.
steps.instruction: Enable FMD in Settings.

steps.expected: Device should not be able to connect to a network, etc. Device should be in airplane mode.
steps.instruction: Enable airplane mode in Settings.

steps.expected: You should not be able to disable FMD. You should receive a prompt to enable a network connection.
steps.instruction: Attempt to disable FMD in settings.
